task_description: Design a road network that connects unconnected regions to the existing connected areas in an urban environment. Analyze the provided data to determine which road construction will maximize network connectivity.
data_schema:
- Connected regions: A list of regions that are already connected.
- Connectivity: A list of tuples (node_1, node_2, distance) representing existing undirected roads between nodes, where distance is in kilometers.
- Unconnected regions: A list of regions that are currently isolated from the network.
- region_nodes: A list of boundary nodes defining the geographical extent of each region.
- Available roads: A list of potential roads that can be constructed to improve connectivity.
- road_edge: A tuple (node_1, node_2, distance) representing an undirected road segment available for construction, with the distance specified in kilometers.
- new_roads: A list of tuples (node_1, node_2, distance) representing additional road segments that may be built following the initial construction.
domain_knowledge:
- The task is split into two stages.
- In stage_1, you need to identify the optimal road to construct next that connects the largest number of currently unconnected regions.
- In stage_2, you need to identify identify the optimal road to construct next minimize travel distances among all regions.
- Use logical reasoning to determine the best traffic signal activation. DO NOT write any code or algorithms.
task_target: determine the most suitable road to build next.
action_space: - Select the ID of a road segment from the available options as your action.
